title: Toddler handed to distant relative who savagely beat her to death after catalogue of social service failings
text:
News Toddler handed to distant relative who savagely beat her to death after catalogue of social service failings “Vicious and unfeeling” Kandyce Downer left baby Shi-Anne with 153 scars and bruises and delayed calling 999 after the brutal attack Share Shi-Anne was left with horrific injuries and could not be saved by medics Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
An 18-month-old girl was "almost invisible" to social services before being brutally beaten to death by her evil foster mum, a damning report found. 
An inquiry into the death of Shi-Anne Downer found she was visited just once by social work professionals after being taken into care and placed in the hands of distant relative Kandyce Downer. 
Dubbed “vicious and unfeeling”, the business student attempted to deflect suspicion onto her teenage son, claiming most of Shi-Anne's day-to-day care was down to him and her three younger children when asked to explain the youngster’s grave injuries. Kandyce Downer was meant to protect Shi-Anne but instead killed her Read More Barbaric foster mum who battered toddler to death leaving her with 153 injuries set to appeal life sentence 
Medics battled to save her, but she died from blood poisoning, infection, blunt chest trauma and head injuries. 
Shi-Anne, from Birmingham, had only been in mum-of-four Kandyce's care for 10 months when she was murdered in September 2015. 
The twisted foster mum was jailed for a minimum of 18 years and the case is an ever-lasting stain on Birmingham city council's reputation. 
Now a serious case review has found Shi-Anne was "almost invisible to professionals" who only visited her once between being handed over to Kandyce and her death, the Birmingham Mail reported . The tot's life was tragically cut short Read More 
Shi-Anne was barely considered after the decision to issue the special guardianship order - a legal document giving Kandyce custody of the girl - was taken. 
“The voice of Shi-Anne was regularly missed,” the damning report states. 
Although it found no-one could have predicted Kandyce would turn into a child killer, the report said there were risk factors and more regular checks could have set alarm bells ringing. 
Factors that could have led to concerns about Kandyce's fitness to look after another child included: two historical episodes of domestic abuse, a period of stress leading to time off work, a new partner and an unplanned pregnancy, the report said. The evil foster mum was jailed for a minimum of 18 years (Photo: PA) The areas of the toddler's body that was affected by injuries including the rib cage, right pelvis, right femur and left femur (Photo: SWNS) Read More Murdered millionaire author Helen Bailey's parents reveal fresh heartache as death of killer's first wife re-examined 
It concluded: "There is no evidence why Kandyce Downer changed from that loving mother into the brutal attacker. As a result... Shi-Anne’s death couldn’t have been predicted. 
"It is felt though, that if there was a supervision order in place... the opportunity for Kandyce Downer to carry out these assaults could have been prevented by the involvement of professional action and curiosity into the life of Kandyce Downer and the children - in particular Shi-Anne.” 
Penny Thompson, who chairs the Birmingham Safeguarding Children Board, said: "As a result of this and other cases, national guidance on the use of special guardianship orders has been altered to be more robust and in Birmingham practice and management has fundamentally changed. The youngster had 150 injuries Read More Violent thug who killed banker with single punch in 'senseless unprovoked attack' cleared of murder 
"The checks for special guardianship orders, when a child is placed with relatives, were much more relaxed than those for full adoption but have now been strengthened. 
"This tragic case has informed the improvement of services in Birmingham and will go on to contribute to the training and culture of learning." 
The city council has already stopped the use of outside agencies to assess special guardianship orders and updated its procedures around this. 
An NSPCC spokesman said: "No child should have to endure the horrific abuse that Shi-Anne was subjected to during her tragically short life. Shi-Anne's paternal grandma spoke out after the court case (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Read More Chilling confession of abusive boyfriend who 'lost it' and battered 'loving' partner to death with his fists 
“It is vital that the child remains at the heart of all decisions that professionals make. 
"And someone’s motivation for wanting to take responsibility for a child must be rigorously explored to ensure the child will be safe and brought up in a loving environment." 
During Kandyce's murder trial, it emerged she may have wanted to take in another child for financial reasons. 
In the three months before her death, Shi-Anne was not seen by any health or social services professionals and she was also taken out of her nursery. 
It also emerged during sentencing that Kandycehad tried to secure custody of Shi-Anne’s older sister, but she was already settled with her foster family. Like us on Facebook
